byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Sen David Vitter, surprisingly, has been trailing in race for Louisiana's gubernatorial race, despite fact he is most prominent Republican in decidedly red state; Vitter's Democratic opponent State Rep John Bel Edwards has emerged as formidable challenge after hard-fought Republican primary bruised Vitter's reputation, particularly because his involvement in 2007 prostitution scandal has resurfaced in campaign.
lead_paragraph: Once thought to have an easy path to victory, the Republican senator trails a Democrat in a state that has not elected a Democrat to statewide office since 2008.

headline.main: David Vitter Wages Uphill Bid for Governor in Solidly Red Louisiana
headline.print_headline: A Red State, but Still an Uphill G.O.P. Bid

snippet: Once thought to have an easy path to victory, the Republican senator trails a Democrat in a state that has not elected a Democrat to statewide office since 2008.
